title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
short_description: A classic novel depicting the decadence of the Jazz Age in America.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
short_description: A powerful exploration of racial injustice in the American South during the 1930s.

author: George Orwell
short_description: A dystopian novel portraying a totalitarian society ruled by surveillance and oppression.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
short_description: A fantasy adventure novel following the journey of Bilbo Baggins to reclaim treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
short_description: A classic novel exploring themes of love, reputation, and class in early 19th-century England.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
short_description: A coming-of-age novel narrated by a disenchanted teenager, Holden Caulfield.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
short_description: A mystery thriller that follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he investigates a murder in the Louvre Museum.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
short_description: A landmark novel in magical realism, tracing the Buendía family over several generations in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
short_description: A philosophical novel about a young shepherd named Santiago on a journey to fulfill his personal legend.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
short_description: An epic fantasy trilogy that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
short_description: A dystopian novel imagining a future society characterized by advanced technology and state control.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
short_description: A pioneering science fiction tale about a young scientist who creates a sapient creature in an unorthodox experiment.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
short_description: A passionate story of love and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
short_description: An epic sea adventure centered around Captain Ahab's obsession with a giant white whale.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
short_description: A historical novel set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
short_description: A psychological novel exploring the moral dilemmas of a young man in St. Petersburg.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
short_description: A comedic novel following the adventures of a nobleman who becomes a knight-errant.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
short_description: An epic tale of Russian society during the Napoleonic era.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
short_description: A novel about the lives and struggles of several characters in 19th century France.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
short_description: A tragic story of a married aristocrat and her affair with the affluent Count Vronsky.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
short_description: A philosophical novel set in 19th century Russia, revolving around the moral struggles of the Karamazov family.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
short_description: A novel focusing on the life of a doctor's wife who seeks escape through adulterous relationships.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
short_description: A coming-of-age novel about the personal growth and development of an orphan named Pip.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
short_description: A gothic horror novel introducing Count Dracula, and his attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
short_description: A novel following the adventures of a young boy and an escaped slave as they travel down the Mississippi River.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
short_description: A novel following the experiences of Jane Eyre, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
short_description: A philosophical novel about a young man who remains physically young while his portrait ages.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
short_description: A dystopian novel about a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
short_description: A novel set during the Great Depression, focusing on a family of tenant farmers driven from their Oklahoma home.

title: The Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
short_description: A satirical novel set during World War II, exploring the absurdity and illogic of war and military life.

title: Heart of Darkness
author: Joseph Conrad
short_description: A novella about a voyage up the Congo River into the Congo Free State, in the heart of Africa.

title: Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
short_description: A novel addressing many of the social and intellectual issues faced by African Americans in the early twentieth century.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
short_description: A novel inspired by the African-American experience after the Civil War, exploring themes of family and identity.
